medical_history.chief_complaint: Primary Epstein-Barr virus infection with pneumonia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 1 month after allogeneic bone marrow transplantation. The patient initially presented with fever (temperature 39°C) and dry cough on day 21, persisting despite broad-spectrum antibiotics. Fever returned on day 36 with bilateral crackles noted on chest auscultation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Severe homozygous sickle cell anemia. Previously experienced multiple vaso-occlusive crises and recurrent chest syndromes.
medical_history.family_history: The donor (recipient’s healthy brother) described a history of afebrile upper respiratory symptoms just before donation. Recipient was serologically negative for Epstein-Barr virus prior to transplantation.
